column1: Smoque BBQ////The sides were delicious (such as potatoes
column2: mac & cheese) and they complemented the meal nicely in the sense that they were small sides that while tasty
column3: were not strong or big enough to take the spotlight off of the ribs. The ribs were to die for. Whatever house sauces they have there
column4: whatever methods they use to cook
column6: cooks from - it ALL comes together to make the perfect storm for a volcano eruption of a meal here at Smoque BBQ. For a BBQ lover - this is a MUST SEE place. Not just because TV covered this place
column7: but because it really is that good. Oh and did I mention it's BYOB? Bring some beer
column8: red wine and/or Bourbon whiskey for during the meal. This could truly be a carnivorous man's fave place to eat.
